Slpeen.Name: When to vaccinate?
Slpeen.Details:
• Elective: Vaccines should preferably be given two weeks prior to the procedure.
• If this is not practical, the patient should be immunised as soon as possible after recovery from the operation and before discharge from hospital.
• Patients who have had immunosuppressive chemotherapy or radiotherapy should not be vaccinated for 3 months after treatment.

Slpeen.Name: Inform the patient and relatives
Slpeen.Details:
Patients and relatives must be informed that the spleen has been removed, therefore:
• Antibiotic prophylaxis is necessary for life
• The patient must attend a doctor immediately if they feel unwell
• They should be given a copy of a patient information leaflet
• Patients should be advised to invest in an alert bracelet or card
• Patients should be alerted to the potential risks of overseas travel eg Malaria and also the risks from animal bites.

Slpeen.Name: Documentation
Slpeen.Details:
Document that patient has had a splenectomy and that vaccination and advice regarding antibiotics has been given
• On front of patients chart
• In medical case notes.

Slpeen.Name: Inform the patient's GP
Slpeen.Details: • The patient’s general practitioner should be notified of the splenectomy and vaccinations given (by telephone and in discharge letter).
